p: Regarding blood components, compared with not receiving transfusion, receiving transfusion (with or without criteria) increased the length of hospital stay by 1.29 days (p = 0.0007; IRR = 1.29) and increased the costs by 5.1 times (IRR = 5.1; p<0.001). In addition, patients with comorbidities stayed 1.2 days more than those without comorbidities. However, the variable ‘comorbidities’ was nonsignificant with regard to hospital costs.
